author: radekkapka
content: Is there any reason to keep both GET and POST versions, given that POST is strictly superior? I think we should eventually deprecate and remove GET

author: jgm
content: Agreed, but given that the GET method has been around for a long time I'd be wary about deprecating it in short order.  Once the POST version goes in I'd be inclined to give it a couple of hard forks before removing it.

author: tersec
content: No strong disposition about the deprecation period for this specifically, but curious why a "couple of" hard forks -- does anyone just skip a hard fork, and would be therefore caught out/surprised by a one-hard-fork deprecation for a commonly used call?

author: jgm
content:
Mainly because the time until the next hard fork will be, at some point, arbitrarily small, and it is during the time close to the next hard fork that people are most likely to be busy doing other work and so miss the deprecation. Having at least one full hard fork interval gives people more of a chance to update.

And to be clear: if the change went in today I would suggest that it is deprecated until Electra, and removed at that fork.
